issues.description: The problem statement (UML and textual requirements) specifies that Milkable.messageOnMilk() returns a String (e.g. "[Animal Type] [name] is milked"), but the solution repository defines Milkable.messageOnMilk() to return boolean and the implementations (Goat, Seal) print the message and return true. This contradicts the specified method return type and expected behavior. As a result, students following the problem statement will implement/expect a String-returning method, while the provided solution uses a different signature and side-effects (printing), which would confuse students and cause tests or example usage (e.g. System.out.println(m.messageOnMilk())) to behave differently than described.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the Milkable API and implementations consistent with the problem statement. Change the Milkable interface to declare messageOnMilk() returning String (e.g. `String messageOnMilk();`). Update Goat and Seal to return the message string (e.g. `return "Goat " + getName() + " is milked";`) instead of printing and returning boolean. Ensure example usage (Main) and any tests call and print the returned String. This preserves the intended design and removes the confusion between printing vs returning and mismatched return types.

issues.description: The problem statement and UML specify Milkable.messageOnMilk() as returning a String (and the task text explicitly says messageOnMilk() should return the string "[Animal Type] [name] is milked"). The solution repository, however, defines Milkable.messageOnMilk() to return a boolean and implements Goat and Seal to print the milking message to stdout and return true. Template/Main (commented example) and the problem expect printing System.out.println(m.messageOnMilk()) (i.e., a String). This mismatch in the method's return type and behavior creates a semantic inconsistency: students following the problem will implement/expect a String-returning method, but the solution returns boolean and prints the message, causing confusion and incorrect behavior when code prints the method result.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the solution with the problem: change Milkable.messageOnMilk() to return String (signature: String messageOnMilk()), and update Goat and Seal to return the milking message string (e.g., return "Goat " + getName() + " is milked"). Remove the side-effect printing from the implementations so that callers (e.g., System.out.println(m.messageOnMilk())) receive the expected String.
